name: united-states-nevada-reno

content:
{"annotation":" The capital of Virginia state, Richmond City, has gained popularity during the Civil War in the United States. This city became the capital of the breakaway Confederacy. Richmond has preserved many buildings of the 19th century.
The church of St. John is considered to be the oldest church in the city. It is famous for the fact that Patrick Henry gave his speech in it, which became the starting point of the struggle for the independence of the United States.
There is a beautiful building in Richmond – the White House of the Confederacy. In the 20th of the last century the Museum of the Confederacy was founded there in memory of the Civil War. The monument to the famous general of Southerners, Ambrose Hill, monument to the sailors and soldiers of the Confederate Army and the National Park of the battles of the Civil War bring back the fact that Richmond was the capital of the southern states.
The city has many museums. The most famous of them are the Museum of writer Edgar Allan Poe and the Science Museum. Despite the fact that Richmond is a relatively small city, it has many parks. The most famous of them are Maymont Park, which houses a children's farm and a collection of carriages, and Brown Island, which is known for its outdoor performance stages, and natural historical park Chimborazo.
","map":"place/united-states,virginia,richmond"}
name: united-states-virginia-richmond

content:
{"annotation":" Sacramento – Spanish name disorients guests. There is nothing (or almost nothing) Spanish here. On the contrary, its former name – New Helvetia (Geneva) directly points to its founder – emigrant from Switzerland John Sutter, who arrived in America in search of a better life and built his own city. Since that time the city has flourished, grown up and become the capital of the State of California.
Sacramento became the unofficial capital of the Gold Rush, when gold was found in one of the mines of John Sutter. Since that time the office has been preserved, where the founder of the city worked, now it is the national historic landmark. In Fort Sutter his goods and chattels are kept, atmosphere of those times is carefully recreated, and they say that the ghost of hapless gold prospector is haunting there.
Gold had to be transported and railway tracks were constructed in Sacramento. And in the twentieth century a huge exposition devoted to the railway has been collected there, and the world's largest National Railroad Museum in California has been created. Here you can even go to a tour in a real steam train.
The city always had the ambition to become the capital of the state. So complexes of public buildings of Sacramento impress, because they almost exactly reproduce appearance of the state buildings of America, for example, the Capitol and the Courthouse. By the way, episodes of series “The Mentalist” was filmed here, and sometimes you can meet fans of this series, wandering in anguish around steps, on which Patrick Jane ascended.
Cultural Center of Sacramento – Complex Convention Center. This is an art museum, concert hall, theater of ballet and multifunctional building Memorial Auditorium, here the inauguration of Arnold Schwarzenegger as a governor was held.
The Eagle Theatre, a small building under a square roof, is the first public theater of America. John Sutter Jr. built it, wanting to humanize adventurers, who came in Sacramento from all directions. Gold Rush passed, and the theater has remained.
And the same way is in history: the people went away, and Sacramento lives and will live.
","map":"place/united-states,california,sacramento"}
name: united-states-california-sacramento

content: {"annotation":" Founded in1565 by Pedro Menendez St. Augustine is a place where the natural wealth and beauty of the southern state of Florida and the history of the America conquest century have joined happily. Here it is possible not only to relax and enjoy contact with nature, but also to learn much about the time, when European foot just set on this land. St. Augustine is the city, which has experienced several periods of its development: Spanish, American. Each of the periods left its sights of the city. Here events of Seminole War unfolded, their legendary leader Osceola was kept in a dark Fort San Marco – the oldest fortress of its kind in the United States. It still towers over the city as a reminder of all, without exception, wars that the United States has experienced. Now it is a museum of colonization of national importance, which gives evidence about those times with another fortress, Fort Matanzas. Thrill seekers should visit zoological park \"Alligator Farm\", where 23 species of Florida can be seen in the wild, and feeding the crocodiles will not leave anyone indifferent. The park was established in the so-called \"Flegler\" time, an American millionaire who turned St. Augustine into a popular resort for rich men. Since then the city has preserved quaint houses built as an imitation of the famous historic European buildings. For example, the castle of Zoraida, imitation of the Alhambra. Today St. Augustine is a city that stretch its feet under mahogany of tourists, and you can walk around it in one day. But every street and every house present an animated history of the United States. The oldest wooden school in the United States has preserved, as well as the beautiful Presbyterian Church, Ripley's Museum, which contains funny artifacts, and it is called funny, too: \"Believe it or not!\". Believe it or not, but St. Augustine is one of the most interesting places in America. ","map":"place/united-states,florida,saint-augustine"}
name: united-states-florida-saint-augustine

content:
{"annotation":" St. Louis, Missouri, is an independent city that was founded by the French and named in honor of St. Louis. For a long time his symbol was a statue of the king, erected in front of the art museum in the middle of the park "Forrest".
What a wonderful country America is! Here, where the state emerged almost two hundred years ago, different cultures and languages mixed, but each nation found a place and shelter for itself.
And St. Louis is, in the first place, the French city. The Cathedral of St. Louis is owned by the Roman Catholic Church and borrowed some architectural elements of Notre Dame and Romanesque churches and mosaics of ancient Rome. Such a style-mixing may seem monstrous, but in the reality the builders have guessed somehow with the proportions, and the cathedral is quite harmonious. The second religious building, which one should certainly visit, is   the Abbey of St. Mary and St. Louis. It is a live representative of the Benedictine monastery of Friars, built in 1962. It is hard to describe the Abbey due to its unusual architecture. But there is one thing one can be quite sure about – the skyward looking Cathedral strives to God.
Speaking of the cultural life of St. Louis, for the most part it is concentrated in the public park "Forrest", where one can find Zoo, the Missouri History Museum, the Art Museum of St. Louis and even the exact place where the summer Olympic Games in 1904 took place!
And, of course, what a French town without a triumphal arch may be! And here it is. Generally speaking, it is the most pompous construction in St. Louis and it impresses just deafeningly.
This arch being built in 1968 in honor of the pioneers of St. Louis and American expansion to the West, it is the largest in the Western Hemisphere, and rises to 192 m. The arch is often used as an art object, for example, during the various activities, as the Americans are very practical people.
St. Louis is one of the few cities in which French culture is preserved, and that is what makes it so beautiful. 
 ","map":"place/united-states,michigan,saint-louis"}
name: united-states-michigan-saint-louis

content:
{"annotation":" Small resort town of St. Pete Beach is a real gem of Florida state.
In fact, the main attraction in the city is extremely comfortable, wide beach. It recalls an advertising image from the distant paradise islands: blue water, palm trees, white sand that never heats up to high temperatures. The convenient location of the town on the shore of the Mexico Gulf and wonderful climate make vacation in St. Pete Beach even more attractive.
St. Pete Beach has always been a resort town reached its peak in the 30-ies of XX century. In those times the hotels have been built, which surprise for its architectural delights even today. Loews Don Cesar is one of these buildings. This fantastic building with turrets, carved balustrades and flat roof in a colonial style was depicted in the famous gangster saga "Once Upon a Time in America". The hotel has a restaurant Four Diamond surrounded on the all sides by huge ocean aquariums with marine fauna of Florida. All the presidents of the United States from the mid-twentieth century, except for Reagan visited this hotel. In 1975 Loews Don Cesar was included in the register of historic hotels of the United States.
All hotels are concentrated around the main street of the city – Korey Avenue, where the best shops and boutiques, restaurants and bars are located.
There are a few Historical attractions in St. Pete Beach. The main among them is the historic district of Pass-a-Grille. Today here is a historical city museum with interesting displays telling about Pinellas district, to which the city itself belongs. It is curious that some of the exhibits have a date of 1500 BC! The district is an island of typical colonial architecture of the middle XIX century.
On its face it is unremarkable town. But if you peer closely, you can notice gaping stock in every detail. And everyone knows that it’s always near.
","map":"place/united-states,florida,saint-pete-beach"}
name: united-states-florida-saint-pete-beach

content:
{"annotation":" Salt Lake City is a city of great destiny and extraordinary energy. And the reason is that it was founded by the Mormon settlers who appeared here after persecution by the federal government.
Almost all the attractions of the city are connected with Mormons. Mormons came here for the long haul, and they wanted to make this city the center of the universe, because the Mormon cathedral is located on the central Temple Square established immediately after the founding of the city. Here is a building of the tabernacle of the Mormon church, which is very unusual by architecture and Family Museum with the largest bank of genealogical data in the world.
And monuments of Salt Lake City are up there with magnificent and huge buildings of Temple Square. Founder of the city and the first governor of Utah state was Brigham Young, the second in a row leader of Church. The monument of Young, the monument to the founders of the sugar industry, memorial to the first settlers amaze with their size and the desire to glorify heroes, after which they are installed. Complex, where memorials are located, is called Park Heritage Place. At the same place there is settlement of Utah Pioneers, now – Ethnographic Museum of History with a very interesting exhibition.
It will be interesting for many visitors of the city to visit the Salt Lake City Olympic Park, to see arenas, on which sports passion ran high and life was in full swing during the White Olympiad in 2002.
This is Salt Lake City – the city, which serves as an example of overcoming fate and a symbol of greatness of spirit during literally 10 years of construction. This is rarity for America.
","map":"place/united-states,utah,salt-lake-city"}
name: united-states-utah-salt-lake-city

content:
{"annotation":" San-Antonio is second most important city in the state of Texas after its capital Houston. The unique nature of San-Antonio, like that of many southern cities, is the result of integration of American and Spanish cultures, in addition to the war history of America.
Back in the XIX century, Texas was a contested territory, so locals had to build forts against attacks of numerous enemies. One of these fortifications was Alamo, and around Alamo was built a town of San-Antonio-de-Bejar. Time passed, America held its statesmanship, and military towns became civil ones. One of them was got new names, one of them was San-Antonio.  
The city’s major historical sights are the Temple of Freedom of Texas, a church around which Alamo was built, and the palace of Spanish museums; both are now historical museums.
Another frequently visited place is the embankment of the river San-Antonio. The stream resembles a thin brook but in the dry climate of Texas, every drop of water is precious. So locals have decorated the river brightly, as if trying to please it, and have maintained its flow through many years. The area along the river has become one of the most popular parks for both citizens and tourists.
Other tourist attractions are the SeaWorld oceanarium, the Six Flags theme park and the Morgana’s Wonders theme park where there are entertainments for disabled people. The culminating point of every journey through San-Antonio should be the ascension upon the Tower of Americas, the tallest structure in the city. Its height is 229 meters, and at 176 meters there is a nice restaurant wit spectacular view of the surroundings.
As this tower is the visiting card of San-Antonio, the city itself is the visiting card of the state Texas. 
","map":"place/united-states,texas,san-antonio"}
name: united-states-texas-san-antonio

content:
{"annotation":" The southernmost city in the United States – San Diego – is a symbol of power of the state. Here the main base of the United States Pacific Fleet, the largest port, defense and energy industries are located.
This is the city of the most successful people (as it is believed in the USA), the city that is always working and earning.
And that’s what’s making it so precious to just stop and enjoy the beauty of nature, or to learn something about the history of the country. The old city of San Diego gives us this unique and brilliant opportunity.
The history of the place begins with the arrival of the first settlers from Spain in the XVII century, who finally settled there in the XVIII. If you want to touch the history of the city's foundation, you can go to the park of Presidio, where you will find the tree planted by Huniperro Serra – the Catholic missionary! Of course, one may think of such an enthusiastic attitude today with irony, but the park itself is very beautiful, as well as the other park – Balboa, a place of cultural recreation for residents. Here attractions, theaters, variety shows and museum are concentrated. The most interesting of them is so-called the Living Art Museum, where everyone can create a masterpiece, and then boasts that his artwork is presented in the museum. There is also a whole range of natural science museums. All kinds of them – and just in one place.
The Spanish period has left Park Presidio to the city, well, its location, actually, and the Basilica of San Diego Messiah al Alkalla, after whom the city was named. This basilica is interesting because it is not quite a church. It was some kind of a headquarters of the missionary, who imposed Catholicism with fire and sword on the Kumeuay Indians who lived here before colonization. Nowadays it is a Catholic Church.
The modern center of San Diego located on the shore of the ocean is very beautiful with its skyscrapers, as well as the magnificent Coronado Bridge, one of the three highest and longest bridges in the United States (the first two - the Golden Gate Bridge and Seattle). The bridge was built in view of the fact that San Diego is a sea port, so as the ships should freely pass under the bridge its height is about 61 meters and a length – 3.4 km.
San Diego knows how to work and how to relax and this is its main feature.
","map":"place/united-states,california,san-diego"}
name: united-states-california-san-diego

content:
{"annotation":" The modern San-Francisco is quite similar to the ancient city of Babylon: it is a true melting pot of cultures and languages. However, Babylon was destroyed, while San-Francisco has accepted and adapted to numerous immigrants and people of most versatile opinions. Actually, people are the city’s major sight but there are of course material objects beyond count.
The largest park of San-Francisco is the Golden Bridge Park. It is even bigger than Central Park in New York! No wonder hippies in the 1960s chose this place for their Summer of Love, an amazing manifestation of peace and affection between people. Adjacent to the Golden Bridge is the San-Francisco Zoo, one of the most popular nationwide and worldwide.
San-Francisco’s greatest museum is the Museum of Modern Art which holds one of the most important collections of art in the USA. Another place of interest, both for adults and kids, is the Walt Disney Museum, one and only of its kind in America.
San-Francisco is full of curious things but the main tourist attraction has always been the Golden Bridge. The spectacular construction is 2.77 kilometers long, 27 meters wide and 67 meters long. It was opened on May 27, 1937. Those who believe in the magic of the number seven will find in it explanation for the city’s magnificence.
 ","map":"place/united-states,california,san-francisco"}
name: united-states-california-san-francisco

content:
{"annotation":" The American South is the "new America." Here from the middle of the nineteenth century the southern Spanish culture was merging with American traditions, and Santa Fe is by far the most noticeable example. Its attractions actually reflect these multicultural layers, and while walking down the streets one should pay close attention to the surrounding buildings, streets, and learn its history.
The City Center is so vividly Spanish, colonial, with its flat roofs, so perfect during siesta.
Another typical Spanish building is the famous Cathedral of St. Francis – the most brilliant example of the Romanesque style. Two towers and the central nave of the cathedral send tourists to Italy and Spain of the Renaissance. The interesting fact is that the magnificent stained glass windows are copies of those of the Cathedral of St. Peter in Rome. A statue of Francis is standing in front of the cathedral, a statue of Catherine Tekakhwita, the first saint of the Algonquin tribe, is standing near.
The Governor's House is an architectural monument of national importance, built as a one-story hacienda with an arcade. It is located in the historic district of Santa Fe, where the buildings from the time of the XVII century are preserved, and where also the museum of New Mexico is situated. One of the major expositions is the history of Pueblo is the Indian tribe that lived here before colonization. The Pueblo culture is very popular today so the entire neighborhoods are being built in this architectural style. And here we should mention especially good-looking hotel Pueblo Revival, which has an exhibition devoted to the Indians.
The "American period" is mostly associated with the development of culture of Santa Fe. Perhaps, there is no other city in the USA, except New York, where there are so many museums. Even the block, where they are located is called the Museum Hill. There are plenty different museums: the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum, artist, the Indian Museum, the Museum of Indian women.
Give Santa Fe a chance, and you'll see firsthand how great country was born in the dialogue of cultures.
","map":"place/united-states,new-mexico,santa-fe"}
name: united-states-new-mexico-santa-fe

content:
{"annotation":" Santa-Monica can give you an impression of a celebrity factory; more than thirty stars of various entertainment industries were born there. This explains why there are so many luxurious mansions and villas on the territory of the city. If you look at a gorgeous house you can be sure this is the domicile of Robert Redford, Sean Penn, Christina Ricci or some other famous person.
Santa-Monica is one big tourist attraction; even historic sights are remade into entertainment areas. One of those sights is the Santa-Monica пирс. It was built one hundred years ago and is 150 meters into the sea. This vast territory is one great theme park with tens of entertaining mechanisms and machines. For some it is controversial, for others it is amazing.
Some of the city’s numerous parks are also not just parks. For example, one of them is the location of the Civic Auditorium, a tremendous concert hall which has seen Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Eric Clapton and Bob Dylan. Another place visited often by both celebrities and tourists is McCabe’s guitar store where many rock stars got their legendary instruments. 
Bergamot Station was once a railway station; nowadays it is the centre of art galleries and museums. This place owes its name to patches of wild bergamot growing around this area. Civil servants plant new seeds every year, so air around the station is pretty pleasant to breath. This flavor will follow you throughout their cultural journey, the most interesting point of which is the private aviation museum where you will see a real Soviet Word War II fighter plane Yak-3.
Despite its glamorous look, Santa-Monica is also naturally beautiful. The shore of the ocean is decorated by even lines of tall palms. Other green areas are parks Palisades and Tongva where you can spend either romantic night or family evening.
","map":"place/united-states,california,santa-monica"}
name: united-states-california-santa-monica

content: {"annotation":" Savannah is a unique city located in the USA on the magnificent coast of the Atlantic Ocean. It is quite a big port situated at the mount of the beautiful Savannah river. If you have ever visited this place, you will certainly dream of returning here! The unique architecture of Savannah, its interesting and unusual local customs attract crowds of tourists from all over the world.\n Savannah has lots of sights. Luxury mansions located on Telfair Square are a must-see. The 19th century architecture is really wonderful and unique. It is a little bit cumbersome, but at the same time it is elegant and full of beautiful elements. It really fascinates people. If you are interested in negro culture, you should visit the African-American Heritage Museum! This is really the fount of unusual temperament and mentality. Such places as the Savannah History Museum and the Colonial House Museum will help you to learn interesting facts about the history of Savannah and the life of its citizens. You will be able to enjoy sitting on a wrought iron bench in the shade of centenarian oaks, walking along cobbled streets and breathing in the unusual air of the old days.\n","map":"place/united-states,georgia,savannah"}
name: united-states-georgia-savannah

content:
{"annotation":" Scottsdale is called a small copy of Miami Beach located in the desert. It is a really popularly accepted center of tourism, although all began with the settlement of the Indians. Now the city offers luxury golf courses, well-developed infrastructure, spa centers and upscale hotels. 
  If you decide to visit Scottsdale, be ready for service of the highest level! The city is considered the capital of art and culture of the Southwestern part of the United States. A huge number of museums, galleries and studios are always open to visitors. You should go to the street exhibition of artists “Scottsdale Artwalk”, which takes place every Tuesday. There are a lot of talented works!
You shouldn’t miss the Museum of Fine Arts, Museum of History, the school-studio of the famous architect Frank Wright.
Scottsdale is a real Mecca for lovers of westerns and all things associated with cowboys. Numerous festivals and competitions in cowboy style are held here almost constantly. At the city squares there are monuments in the form of a cowboy saddled mustang. A cowboy is on the city seal as well! Therefore, in Scottsdale amazing atmosphere reigns that mixes bright cocktail of cinema and reality. You will definitely enjoy this place!
","map":"place/united-states,arizona,scottsdale"}
name: united-states-arizona-scottsdale

content:
{"annotation":" It’s the city of rains and winds – exactly the way the local residents call the city of Seattle. An enormous number of rainfalls occur here throughout the year. Despite these damp (in all respects) weather conditions it’s still a megalopolis of big importance and industrial center. Walking about Seattle is a wonderful pastime. The Lake Michigan’s shoreline is a place you shouldn’t miss. It’s a sheer paradise for the fans of sailing and those who just want to relax.
 Neighboring ancient buildings and ultra modern skyscrapers create a unique city atmosphere inside. Outstanding objects of modern architecture are the Smith Tower skyscraper and its neighbor – the Columbia Center which also have areas for sightseeing at the very top.
 History and art connoiceurs are always welcome at the Museum of Music History and Henry Art Gallery. EMP Museum and Seattle Asian Art Museum attract science fiction and movie fans.
 Be sure to visit the Seattle Public Library! This marvelous construction made purely of glass and consisting of 11 floors inevitably draws tourists’ gaze. And, of course, the Space Needle that reaches as high as 200 meters – the biggest Seattle’s landmark and mascot. Plentiful sight grounds allow its visitors to take delight in exquisite land- and cityscapes. 
","map":"place/united-states,washington,seattle"}
name: united-states-washington-seattle

content: {"annotation":"united-states,washington,seattle","map":"place/united-states,arizona,sedona"}
name: united-states-arizona-sedona

content:
{"annotation":" South Lake Tahoe is a beautiful mountain skiing resort situated on the border between two American states, California and Nevada. From the shore of Lake Tahoe tourists can have a wide view of awesome natural landscapes reflected in the crystal clean water. On the territory of the town there are also perfect gulf courses and vast beaches. Those fond of air hockey will certainly visit the Ice arena where men in armor compete every season.
However, South Lake Tahoe is first of all a mountain skiing resort. There are many entertainments connected with slopes and snow for both sport enthusiasts and casual people with their hobbies and children. Main tourist attractions of this resort are walking (on…), slating and riding the dog (упряжка), let alone spectacular views.
Both sport and play leave a person tired; numerous pubs, cafés and restaurants offer great choice of everything an exhausted organism needs. South Lake Tahoe helps maintain perfect balance between rest and activity. 
","map":"place/united-states,california,south-lake-tahoe"}
name: united-states-california-south-lake-tahoe

content:
{"annotation":" Tampa is an amazingly beautiful city located on the shores of Tampa Bay in Florida. The city is one of those American places which are visited by numerous tourists every year. They all are attracted, of course, by the famous splendid beaches, warm ocean water, sailing, surfing and many other water sports. 
And that’s not all! There are a lot of attractions inviting even for the pickiest travelers. If you are lucky enough to visit this amazing city, be sure to see the Museum of Art, the Museum of Science and Industry, an ancient center of manufacturing of Cuban cigars Ybor City, the City Museum and the unique three-storey Florida Aquarium.
Moreover, there is a marvelous water park “Adventure Island”. It actually covers the area of 14 acres of fabulous landscapes and natural scenery. The Natural Park of Hillsborough most definitely will surprise you with its pristine and pure beauty, bright green grass and shady paths with old trees.
And for those who prefer to combine business with pleasure there is a shopping center called Centro Ybor, where you can not only buy the right product, but also enjoy watching movies in a theater with 20 screens. Don’t miss the chance to visit restaurants, shops and clubs on the ​​7th Avenue. Here you will find delicious food, interesting souvenirs and other entertainment. Lowry Park Zoo is the home of nearly 2,000 species of animals, many of which can be found only in America. Well, Tampa is truly beautiful and majestic city, and you will always remember its warm welcome and inexpressible impressions. 
","map":"place/united-states,florida,tampa"}
name: united-states-florida-tampa

content:
{"annotation":" Tucson is one of the largest cities in Arizona, USA. It is a prominent industrial center but its history is connected with the Spanish Catholic mission. However, only few sights are of religious origin. One of them is the San Xavier Mission built in the XVII century. Thanks to constant work of реставраторы, it has to our days maintained the architecture and spirit of the epoch of the Spanish colonization.
Tucson is famous among cinema professionals and enthusiasts. Its deserted landscape had been complemented by decorations for shooting westerns. Besides sand, there is also green; the city is full of quiet parks with crystal clean ponds.
In the Arizona Sonora Desert Museum  you will see wondrous creatures and plants natural to this climate, while the Saguaro National Park features exotic cacti 20 meters tall! The blend of history, modernity and local flavor makes Tucson a truly unique place.
","map":"place/united-states,arizona,tucson"}
name: united-states-arizona-tucson

content:
{"annotation":" The resort town of Virginia Beach is located in the eastern part of the coast of Virginia. A huge number of casinos, leisure centers, parks and other places of entertainment in Virginia Beach attract many tourists and just those who want to spend their time pleasantly. The city is so much popular recreation center thanks to the upscale hotel service, well maintained beaches and, last but not least, the most perfect weather conditions.
Moreover, Virginia Beach is full of attractions for every taste. And anyone will find a place for himself there. Maritime adventure in pirate style is waiting for you on the pirate ship of Captain Jake - "The Lost Pearl". The ship is an exact copy of a real Spanish galleon, and you have the unique chance to go on a voyage and even shoot a gun.
You also should not lose an opportunity to visit Knotts Island. The place is a real paradise with its splendid nature, heady pure air and vast areas of vineyards. By the way, here you can taste several types of wines, which are worldly known.
Your vacation in Virginia Beach will be even more memorable, if you visit the local horse-riding center, a gift shop "Virginia", a chic shop of vintage and sophisticated gizmos "Chartreuse".
","map":"place/united-states,virginia,virginia-beach"}
name: united-states-virginia-virginia-beach

content:
{"annotation":" "Wailea – why so much talk?" 
 Wailea is a resort on the Maui Island, Hawaii, which is famous with its golf fields, luxurious beaches and splendid hotels. It’s a place where you can have peace of mind and soul.
 The biggest advantage of Wailea and the whole Island of Maui is its magical nature. Can you fathom – there are 11 parks on the territory of the city only! 
 Haleakala National Park is situated on the territory of the same-named inactive volcano, the highest in the world. You will be absorbed in the virgin splendor of its rainforests and the whole system of natural waterfalls Seven Sacred Pools.
 A trip to Wailea is a gift to cherish not only a golf fan or a fancier of snow-white beaches – it will also indulge the sacred fantasies of divers. One of Maui wonders is the Molokini Crater –partially covered with water, this volcano crater is one of the best places for diving. More than 40 coral species found here give home to hundreds of tropical fish species. This place is secured against ocean streams and it makes it suitable even for beginners in diving.
 To add even more to this, Wailea holds annual February Whale Festival – a true gift for natural beauty connoisseurs.
","map":"place/united-states,hawaii,wailea"}
name: united-states-hawaii-wailea

content:
{"annotation":" The majority of fundamental historical and architectural sights of the USA are situated in Washington, D.C. This city attracts thousands of tourists who want to learn about the path of the world’s most influential country. 
 Guests of the capital usually begin their journey with the National Mall. Despite its commercial name it is actually a great park. In the center of this area there is an impressive obelisk dedicated to the triumph of the first American President, The Washington Monument. Not very far from this piece of stone tourists can see monuments to other renowned presidents, Jefferson and Lincoln. In the near same vicinity there are the columns of the White House and the dome of the Capitol. Other places to visit are the National Zoo and the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory.
 Heroes of the World War II are also immortalized in the glorious monument that depicts soldiers who had heard the call of duty and answered. As every war memorial, it is a constant reminder of the value of loyalty and peace.
 The world’s most visited museums are situated within the territory of the National Mall. They are the Smithsonian Museum, National Air and Space Museum and National Museum of Natural History. Though their names all say “national”, these reserves of knowledge are open to every curious mind. 
","map":"place/united-states,washington-d-c"}
name: united-states-washington-d-c-washington-d-c

content:
{"annotation":" West Hollywood in general and Santa Monica Boulevard in particular are considered to be “Russian” areas of the Los Angeles urban agglomeration. The statistics show that 8% of local dwellers are immigrants from the post-Soviet countries. 
 Along the Alta Loma Road you can find the famous Sunset Marquis Hotel, and within it, even more famous 45-person Whisky Bar. This hotel has seen more than a few dramatic situations with celebrities of both the previous and present century.
 It’s noticeable that West Hollywood was founded by homosexual men; even its administration is staffed by open gays. They say the British singer and composer Sir Elton John was so impressed by this fact that he has chosen this place for the awarding events of his AIDS Foundation.
West Hollywood can also boast unique architectural sights; among them are 9200 Sunset, the Schindler House, Andaz West Hollywood, Chamberlain West Hollywood Hotel and many others.
The guests of West Hollywood should also visit West Hollywood Gateway Project, the city's largest shopping center that is home to Los Angeles' largest public art piece using projection technology.
","map":"place/united-states,west-hollywood"}
name: united-states-california-west-hollywood

content:
{"annotation":" The town of Williamsburg had been the capital of Virginia for two hundred years before that title passed to the nowadays Richmond. Williamsburg was named after the English king William III but the name is not the only thing about this place that is English. The architecture of most buildings reminds of the town’s colonial past, which gives it certain charm.
 Williamsburg is famous as the location of one of the oldest higher education facilities in the USA. The College of William & Mary was founded in 1693 by the Royal Charter of British monarchs. It was alma mater for Thomas Jefferson and other renowned Americans.
 There are no spectacular sights in Williamsburg, but history itself lives on in this town. Every day thousands of locals put on colonial garments and behave like it’s XVIII century. Some of them even keep on to traditional craft and use the same recipes that did masters of old. The Williamsburg of past is totally worth any investment. Citizens are glad to recreate the image of an English town and to imitate the everyday life of their “ancestors”. If you see a Union Jack hanging from above the door of the house, you can enter and enjoy the hospitality of colonial hosts. 
","map":"place/united-states,virginia,williamsburg"}
name: united-states-virginia-williamsburg

content:
{"annotation":" Wisconsin Dells is a little American town with great worldwide reputation. Despite low population (about 2000) it was the first in the USA to have an indoor water park. Since that time (1994) there have been built 17 more water parks which cover enourmous 28 hectares of space. It is rightfully called “Waterpark Capital of the World”. Tourists from all around the planet come here to visit the biggest oudoor and indoor water parks in America, “Noah’s Ark” and “Wilderness Territory”.
 Every year one certain water-themed event, “Tommy Barlett’s Thrill Show”, attracts thousands of people. It began sixty years ago, and since that time it has been doing what it’s become perfect at - thrilling with fantastic stunts over water, on water and under water. Wonders don’t end there; like many other tourist areas, Wisconsin Dells houses “Ripley’s Believe It or Not!”. Museums of this franchise are full of displays that will make anyone doubt what reality they are in.
 Inside and outside the town, there are also opportunities for those who are fond of kart racing, horse riding, gulf and water sports. The annual count of tourists visiting Wisconcin Dells exceeds five million. 
","map":"place/united-states,wisconsin,wisconsin-dells"}
name: united-states-wisconsin-wisconsin-dells

content:
{"annotation":"Cozy country in Latin America – Uruguay received the name of “South American Switzerland” with good reason. Here you will find a huge number of natural and historical attractions, the high level of development and comfortable and friendly atmosphere.
You should begin the tour around the country from the capital Montevideo. It organically combines modern and colonial-era buildings, beautiful parks and office buildings. Independence Square is considered as the largest one, Mausoleum de Artigo is located on it. There is also the Palacio Salvo – the highest building in South America. National History Museum, Plaza de la Constitucion Square, ancient churches boggle the imagination.
All fans of shopping will appreciate port district of Mercado del Puerto with many shopping centers and markets. Besides the city of Montevideo tourists pay their attention to such tour object as Colonia del Sacramento. Founded in the era of colonization, it is famous for unique buildings. Every year farmers come here from all over Uruguay to visit the largest agricultural exhibition and purchase the best fruits of the harvest.
Coast of Uruguay inspire tourist by island Gorriti, which contains the number of upscale beaches. Nearby there is Lobos – an island-reserve, home to sea lions.
","map":"place/uruguay"}
name: uruguay

content:
{"annotation":" Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay, offers multiple opportunities for tourists of every kind. Beach enthusiasts can grab their surfing boards and head right to the shore of the Atlantic ocean. Curious ones, however, would want to stay awhile in the city and feast their eyes on local sights. 
A journey through Montevideo usually begins with the National History Museum which is situated in the oldest district of the city. The museum is quite easy to find; its octagonal dome makes it the key landmark of the capital.
 The next tourist destination in Montevideo is Palacio Legislativo – The Legislative Palace. The palace is a must for those who appreciate exquisite architecture of the exterior and opulent design of the interior. The pure marble is decorated by dazzling gold and glimmering silver. The four sides of the palace are oriented towards the four corners of the world.
 Other important spots on the tourist route through the capital would be Plaza Independencia with Palacio Salvo and Plaza Constitucion with the Montevideo Metropolitan Cathedral. When you have visited all these places, you may go relax on one of the numerous beaches or in one of the spacious parks. By the way, the capital’s maim park, Parque Rodo, combines these two as it is situated right on the shore! In this place, exotic features like colorful parrots and magnificent marine views intersect with urban features like perfect lawns and alleys. Montevideo is one city that is versatile enough to enjoy every aspect of it!
","map":"place/uruguay,montevideo-department,montevideo"}
name: uruguay-montevideo-department-montevideo

content:
{"annotation":"Amazing exotic country Vietnam is conveniently nestled in Southeast Asia. Asian curiosity of Vietnam is sweet with the odours of jasmine, is coloured with monolithic ancient temples, mesmerizes by warm beaches and inspires by skyscrapers. Europeans and Americans, who prefer both open spaces of nature and loftiness of buildings, certainly appreciate Hanoi.
In the vicinity of this city there are many tourist attractions. Start your journey from Halong Bay protected by UNESCO. The water surface of this bay is covered by three thousand small islands. In Danang you can see the pass Khaiwan, water park, beautiful mountains Nguhanshon.
Metropolis of Ho Chi Minh surprises you by the sea of quarters, streets, cathedrals and temples. In Nha Trang firstly it is worthy to go for the Cham Po Nagar Towers. Today there are four towers. Long Son pagoda and Buddha statue are also remarkable. The Museum of the marine fauna will be particularly interesting to children: more than eight thousands of freshwater and marine animals live there.
Being in Vietnam, you should visit Dalat and its surroundings. Charming architecture, flower gardens, art gallery of Madame Dang Viet Nga, waterfall and lake will give a lot of emotions.
Romantics will appreciate tours to Mekong River. Bright and diverse world of floating rivers will present you unusual rural life of Vietnamese.
","map":"place/vietnam"}
name: vietnam

content:
{"annotation":" Hanoi, the capital of exotic Vietnam, is situated on the bank of the river Hong Ha, also known as the Red River. This city is the wonderful blend of old and modern, Asian and European, eternal and everyday, which makes Hanoi one of the most popular tourist attractions.
 The Old Quarter of the city is named “36 Old Streets”. In Hanoi’s first years of existence, merchants conducted their operations along these streets. Depending on which guild owned the trade, they were called the Silk, Silver, Sugar, Paper, Jewel, Tin streets. These and thirty more names live on in the Old Quarter of Hanoi. Local houses have unusually narrow facades and rooms, which makes them look like tunnels. The main landmark of the “36 Old Streets” is the Temple of the White Horse. Legends hold it that King Lee saw a horse there that showed him where the walls of the city should be raised.
 The modern part of Hanoi is represented by wide avenues, spacious parks and colossal skyscrapers. However, there are also historical and simply beautiful sights like the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, Presidential Palace and Sword Lake. The origin of this name and many other secrets keep visitors of Hanoi curious and entertained. 
","map":"place/vietnam,ha-noi,hanoi"}
name: vietnam-ha-noi-hanoi

content:
{"annotation":"Ho Chi Minh City, also known as Saigon, is one of the greatest megalopolises not only in Vietnam but also in the world. Those who enter this city become a small drop in the ocean of scooters, bicycles, mopeds and automobiles. However, chances of getting lost are close to zero, as tourist infrastructure of Saigon meets every modern expectation. All hotels, humble and luxurious, are easy to find and access.
 As Vietnam was once part of the colonial France, some of the sights are of French origin. Two of them are Reunification Palace and Saigon Notre-Dame Basilica. This cathedral is situated on the Paris Commune Square, and its architecture doubles that of the legendary Notre-Dame de Paris. Not only is it the city’s gothic crown but also one of the catholic centers in Asia. Thanks to this fact, Ho Chi Minh City is sometimes called “Paris of the Orient”.
 Visitors that have got enough of stone can go walk on green in the Dam Sen Tourist and Cultural park. This enormous area offers rest from the routine of the city and invites to have a look at the miniature copy of Saigon, enjoy muppet performances, swim in a water park and breath in the exquisite flavors of the Nam Tu royal garden. There grow rare plants and flowers from India, Laos, Thailand and Cambodia. 
","map":"place/vietnam,ho-chi-minh-city-province,ho-chi-minh-city"}
name: vietnam-ho-chi-minh-city-province-ho-chi-minh-city

content: {"annotation":" Hoi An is situated in the central part of Vietnam. It’s widely famous with its dazzling white beaches and the old town which is included in UNESCO’s World Heritage site Fund. Chinese influence can be read everywhere: tiled roofs and narrow streets.\n In Hoi An you can come across some houses that are more than 300 years old. The Meeting Hall, which was built in 1776 by the Chinese, will make you hold your breath with its intricate wooden carvings. The Chuc Thanh Pagoda is the oldest in the city. All the trips around Hoi An usually start with it. The Japanese Covered Bridge is yet another place of interest. It was built in 16th century to join the Japanese community with the China town. The roof was a protection against rains and scorching sun. It’s a mighty and sturdy construction because this region is subject to earthquakes. One side of the bridge sports figures of two dogs, another – two monkeys. The legend says the bridge building was started in the year of monkey and finished in the year of the dog. Another sightseeing object is the Tran’s Chapel. The Tran’s family moved to Hoi An from China about 300 years ago and introduced an impact on the city’s history and architecture.\n","map":"place/vietnam,quang-nam,hoi-an"}
name: vietnam-quang-nam-hoi-an
